intro: Microstylis kabensis, commonly known as the Kabense microstylis, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Commelinaceae, which includes grass-like plants and some aquatic species. The plant is characterized by its small, delicate flowers and grass-like foliage. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
